ChildrensBooks.title: The Very Hungry Caterpillar
ChildrensBooks.description: A classic picture book by Eric Carle that follows the journey of a caterpillar as it eats its way through a wide variety of foodstuffs before pupating and emerging as a butterfly.

ChildrensBooks.title: Where the Wild Things Are
ChildrensBooks.description: Maurice Sendak's iconic story of Max, a mischievous boy who sails away to an island inhabited by Wild Things.

ChildrensBooks.title: Goodnight Moon
ChildrensBooks.description: A beloved bedtime story by Margaret Wise Brown, featuring a bunny saying goodnight to everything in its room.

ChildrensBooks.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
ChildrensBooks.description: The first book in the magical Harry Potter series by J.K. Rowling, introducing the world of Hogwarts.

ChildrensBooks.title: The Cat in the Hat
ChildrensBooks.description: Dr. Seuss's classic tale of a tall, mischievous cat who turns a rainy day into an adventure for Sally and her brother.

ChildrensBooks.title: Charlotte's Web
ChildrensBooks.description: E.B. White's heartwarming story about the friendship between a pig named Wilbur and a spider named Charlotte.

ChildrensBooks.title: The Gruffalo
ChildrensBooks.description: A clever mouse walks through the woods and encounters several dangerous animals, whom he outsmarts by inventing a terrifying monster, the Gruffalo.

ChildrensBooks.title: Panchatantra Stories for Kids
ChildrensBooks.description: A collection of ancient Indian animal fables, each with a moral, designed to impart wisdom to young readers.

ChildrensBooks.title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid
ChildrensBooks.description: The first book in Jeff Kinney's wildly popular series, presented as the journal of middle-schooler Greg Heffley.

ChildrensBooks.title: Don't Let the Pigeon Drive the Bus!
ChildrensBooks.description: An interactive and hilarious book by Mo Willems where a persistent pigeon tries to convince the reader to let it drive a bus.

ChildrensBooks.title: Matilda
ChildrensBooks.description: Roald Dahl's story of a brilliant and telekinetic young girl who stands up to her neglectful parents and tyrannical headmistress.

ChildrensBooks.title: The Giving Tree
ChildrensBooks.description: Shel Silverstein's poignant story about the relationship between a boy and a tree that gives him everything it has.

ChildrensBooks.title: Percy Jackson & The Lightning Thief
ChildrensBooks.description: The first book in Rick Riordan's fantasy-adventure series based on Greek mythology, following demigod Percy Jackson.

ChildrensBooks.title: Brown Bear, Brown Bear, What Do You See?
ChildrensBooks.description: A classic board book by Bill Martin Jr. and Eric Carle that helps children associate colors and meanings with objects.

ChildrensBooks.title: Amar Chitra Katha (Collection)
ChildrensBooks.description: A collection of illustrated comics based on Indian mythology, history, and folklore.

SelfHelpBooks.title: Atomic Habits
SelfHelpBooks.description: James Clear's practical guide on how to build good habits and break bad ones, using a framework called the Four Laws of Behavior Change.

SelfHelpBooks.title: The Power of Your Subconscious Mind
SelfHelpBooks.description: Dr. Joseph Murphy's classic book on how to use the power of your mind to change your destiny.

SelfHelpBooks.title: Ikigai: The Japanese Secret to a Long and Happy Life
SelfHelpBooks.description: Explore the Japanese concept of 'ikigai' (a reason for being) to find your purpose and live a more fulfilling life.

SelfHelpBooks.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
SelfHelpBooks.description: Mark Manson's counterintuitive approach to living a good life, focusing on what truly matters.

SelfHelpBooks.title: How to Win Friends and Influence People
SelfHelpBooks.description: Dale Carnegie's timeless bestseller on how to improve your social skills and relationships.

SelfHelpBooks.title: Rich Dad Poor Dad
SelfHelpBooks.description: Robert Kiyosaki's personal finance classic that challenges conventional wisdom about money and investing.

SelfHelpBooks.title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
SelfHelpBooks.description: Stephen Covey's principle-centered approach for solving personal and professional problems.

SelfHelpBooks.title: Think and Grow Rich
SelfHelpBooks.description: Napoleon Hill's motivational classic, based on his study of successful individuals, outlining the 'Thirteen Steps to Riches'.

SelfHelpBooks.title: Man's Search for Meaning
SelfHelpBooks.description: Viktor Frankl's memoir of his experiences in Nazi concentration camps and his development of logotherapy.

SelfHelpBooks.title: The Psychology of Money
SelfHelpBooks.description: Morgan Housel's timeless lessons on wealth, greed, and happiness, exploring the strange ways people think about money.

SelfHelpBooks.title: Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success
SelfHelpBooks.description: Cal Newport's guide to developing the ability to focus without distraction on a cognitively demanding task.

SelfHelpBooks.title: You Can Heal Your Life
SelfHelpBooks.description: Louise Hay's seminal book on the power of affirmations and self-love to heal one's life.

SelfHelpBooks.title: The Alchemist
SelfHelpBooks.description: Paulo Coelho's enchanting fable about a shepherd boy who journeys to find treasure and discovers himself along the way.

SelfHelpBooks.title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
SelfHelpBooks.description: Yuval Noah Harari's exploration of the history of Homo sapiens, from the Stone Age to the present day.

SelfHelpBooks.title: The Monk Who Sold His Ferrari
SelfHelpBooks.description: A fable by Robin Sharma about a successful lawyer who seeks spiritual wisdom after a health crisis.

Novels.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Novels.description: Harper Lee's Pulitzer Prize-winning novel about racial injustice in the American South, seen through the eyes of a young girl.
George Orwell's dystopian masterpiece about a totalitarian society where Big Brother is always watching.

Novels.title: The Great Gatsby
Novels.description: F. Scott Fitzgerald's novel about the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsessive love for Daisy Buchanan.

Novels.title: Pride and Prejudice
Novels.description: Jane Austen's classic romance novel about the spirited Elizabeth Bennet and the proud Mr. Darcy.

Novels.title: The Kite Runner
Novels.description: Khaled Hosseini's powerful story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption set against the backdrop of a changing Afghanistan.

Novels.title: The Catcher in the Rye
Novels.description: J.D. Salinger's novel about the angst-ridden teenager Holden Caulfield and his experiences in New York City.

Novels.title: A Thousand Splendid Suns
Novels.description: Another masterpiece by Khaled Hosseini, chronicling the lives of two Afghan women over three decades of turmoil.

Novels.title: The Palace of Illusions
Novels.description: Chitra Banerjee Divakaruni's reimagining of the Mahabharata, told from the perspective of Draupadi (Panchaali).

Novels.title: Brave New World
Novels.description: Aldous Huxley's dystopian novel exploring a future society genetically engineered into a caste system.

Novels.title: The God of Small Things
Novels.description: Arundhati Roy's Booker Prize-winning novel about the childhood experiences of fraternal twins in Kerala, India.

Novels.title: Animal Farm
Novels.description: George Orwell's allegorical novella where farm animals rebel against their human farmer, hoping to create a society of equality.

Novels.title: Train to Pakistan
Novels.description: Khushwant Singh's historical novel recounting the 1947 partition of India through the microcosm of a fictional village.

Novels.title: The Lord of the Rings
Novels.description: J.R.R. Tolkien's epic high-fantasy novel, chronicling the quest to destroy the One Ring.

Novels.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
Novels.description: Gabriel García Márquez's landmark novel that tells the multi-generational story of the Buendía family in the town of Macondo.

Novels.title: Shantaram
Novels.description: Gregory David Roberts' novel about a convicted Australian bank robber who escapes and flees to the slums of Mumbai.

EconomicsCommerce.title: The Intelligent Investor
EconomicsCommerce.description: Benjamin Graham's classic on value investing, considered the stock market bible since its first publication.

EconomicsCommerce.title: Freakonomics
EconomicsCommerce.description: Steven Levitt and Stephen Dubner explore the hidden side of everything, applying economic theory to diverse subjects.

EconomicsCommerce.title: Capital in the Twenty-First Century
EconomicsCommerce.description: Thomas Piketty's analysis of wealth and income inequality in Europe and the United States since the 18th century.

EconomicsCommerce.title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
EconomicsCommerce.description: Daniel Kahneman's exploration of the two systems that drive the way we think and make choices.

EconomicsCommerce.title: Indian Economy by Ramesh Singh
EconomicsCommerce.description: A comprehensive textbook on the Indian economy, widely used by civil services aspirants.

EconomicsCommerce.title: The Wealth of Nations
EconomicsCommerce.description: Adam Smith's foundational work in classical economics, exploring concepts like division of labor and the free market.

EconomicsCommerce.title: Zero to One
EconomicsCommerce.description: Peter Thiel's notes on startups, or how to build the future by creating new things.

EconomicsCommerce.title: Nudge: Improving Decisions about Health, Wealth, and Happiness
EconomicsCommerce.description: Richard Thaler and Cass Sunstein's book on behavioral economics and how to guide people toward better choices.

EconomicsCommerce.title: Principles of Economics by N. Gregory Mankiw
EconomicsCommerce.description: A popular introductory textbook in economics that covers both microeconomics and macroeconomics.

EconomicsCommerce.title: The Lean Startup
EconomicsCommerce.description: Eric Ries's approach to creating and managing successful startups in an age of extreme uncertainty.

EconomicsCommerce.title: Good to Great
EconomicsCommerce.description: Jim Collins's study on why some companies make the leap to greatness and others don't.

EconomicsCommerce.title: Doughnut Economics
EconomicsCommerce.description: Kate Raworth's seven ways to think like a 21st-century economist, challenging the foundations of mainstream economics.

EconomicsCommerce.title: Financial Accounting for Management
EconomicsCommerce.description: An essential textbook covering the fundamentals of financial accounting for commerce students and managers.

EconomicsCommerce.title: The Black Swan
EconomicsCommerce.description: Nassim Nicholas Taleb's work on the impact of highly improbable events.

EconomicsCommerce.title: Business Studies Class 12
EconomicsCommerce.description: NCERT textbook for Class 12, covering the principles and functions of management and business finance.

ReligiousBooks.title: Bhagavad Gita As It Is
ReligiousBooks.description: A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada's translation and commentary on the sacred Hindu scripture, the Bhagavad Gita.

ReligiousBooks.title: The Holy Quran (English Translation)
ReligiousBooks.description: An English translation of the central religious text of Islam, believed by Muslims to be a revelation from God (Allah).

ReligiousBooks.title: The Holy Bible (King James Version)
ReligiousBooks.description: A classic English translation of the Christian Bible, known for its majestic style and literary beauty.

ReligiousBooks.title: Autobiography of a Yogi
ReligiousBooks.description: Paramahansa Yogananda's spiritual classic, introducing many to the teachings of meditation and Kriya Yoga.

ReligiousBooks.title: The Ramayana: A Shortened Modern Prose Version
ReligiousBooks.description: R.K. Narayan's retelling of the ancient Indian epic of Rama's quest to rescue his beloved wife Sita.

ReligiousBooks.title: The Tibetan Book of Living and Dying
ReligiousBooks.description: Sogyal Rinpoche's comprehensive manual on life, death, and the spiritual path from the Tibetan Buddhist perspective.

ReligiousBooks.title: Shri Guru Granth Sahib (English Translation)
ReligiousBooks.description: An English translation of the central religious scripture of Sikhism, regarded by Sikhs as the final, sovereign Guru.

ReligiousBooks.title: The Dhammapada
ReligiousBooks.description: A collection of sayings of the Buddha in verse form, one of the most widely read and best-known Buddhist scriptures.

ReligiousBooks.title: The Upanishads: Breath of the Eternal
ReligiousBooks.description: A translation by Swami Prabhavananda that captures the spiritual essence of the core philosophical texts of Hinduism.

ReligiousBooks.title: The Book of Mormon
ReligiousBooks.description: A sacred text of the Latter Day Saint movement, which contains writings of ancient prophets in the Americas.

ReligiousBooks.title: Mere Christianity
ReligiousBooks.description: C.S. Lewis's classic work of Christian apologetics, adapted from a series of BBC radio talks.

ReligiousBooks.title: The Art of Happiness by The Dalai Lama
ReligiousBooks.description: A practical guide to achieving happiness through the teachings of the Dalai Lama, blending Buddhist wisdom with psychology.

ReligiousBooks.title: Tao Te Ching
ReligiousBooks.description: Lao Tzu's foundational text of Taoism, offering profound wisdom on living in harmony with the natural way of the universe.

ReligiousBooks.title: The Zohar (Abridged Edition)
ReligiousBooks.description: An accessible edition of the foundational work in the literature of Jewish mystical thought known as Kabbalah.

ReligiousBooks.title: Srimad Bhagavatam (Canto 1)
ReligiousBooks.description: The first canto of the epic Puranic text, revered in Vaishnavism, detailing the avatars of Vishnu.

ViewAllBooks.title: A Brief History of Time
ViewAllBooks.description: Stephen Hawking's classic work on cosmology, written for a general audience, exploring the origins and fate of the universe.

ViewAllBooks.title: The Diary of a Young Girl
ViewAllBooks.description: The writings from the diary of Anne Frank, a Jewish girl who hid from the Nazis with her family during World War II.

ViewAllBooks.title: Wings of Fire
ViewAllBooks.description: The autobiography of Dr. A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, the former President of India, covering his early life and career.

ViewAllBooks.title: The Immortals of Meluha
ViewAllBooks.description: The first book in the Shiva Trilogy by Amish Tripathi, a fantasy reimagining of the Hindu deity Shiva as a tribal chief.

ViewAllBooks.title: Becoming
ViewAllBooks.description: The memoir of former First Lady of the United States Michelle Obama, detailing her personal journey.

ViewAllBooks.title: And Then There Were None
ViewAllBooks.description: Agatha Christie's masterpiece of suspense, where ten strangers are lured to an isolated island and picked off one by one.

ViewAllBooks.title: A Man Called Ove
ViewAllBooks.description: Fredrik Backman's charming and moving novel about a grumpy yet lovable man whose solitary world is turned upside down.

ViewAllBooks.title: The Da Vinci Code
ViewAllBooks.description: Dan Brown's thrilling novel that follows symbologist Robert Langdon as he uncovers a conspiracy hidden in the works of Leonardo da Vinci.

ViewAllBooks.title: Cosmos
ViewAllBooks.description: Carl Sagan's exploration of 15 billion years of cosmic evolution, transforming complex scientific ideas into accessible narratives.

ViewAllBooks.title: Guns, Germs, and Steel
ViewAllBooks.description: Jared Diamond's Pulitzer Prize-winning book that argues geographical and environmental factors shaped the modern world.

ViewAllBooks.title: Where the Crawdads Sing
ViewAllBooks.description: Delia Owens's novel about a young woman who grows up isolated in the marshes of North Carolina and becomes a murder suspect.

ViewAllBooks.title: A Short History of Nearly Everything
ViewAllBooks.description: Bill Bryson's journey through science, from the Big Bang to the rise of civilization, explaining it all in an accessible way.

ViewAllBooks.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
ViewAllBooks.description: Stieg Larsson's gripping psychological thriller that introduces the characters of Mikael Blomkvist and Lisbeth Salander.

ViewAllBooks.title: Educated: A Memoir
ViewAllBooks.description: Tara Westover's memoir about her journey from growing up in a survivalist family in rural Idaho to earning a PhD from Cambridge.

ViewAllBooks.title: The Silent Patient
ViewAllBooks.description: Alex Michaelides's shocking psychological thriller about a psychotherapist's obsession with a famous painter who has gone silent.
